title: Problem-Solving Competency Development Course Based on Failure Case Studies

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: A corporate manager leadership development program conducted in a smartphone-based limited technological environment

learning_goals: Learners can analyze real-world workplace failure cases and derive at least three root causes of problems.
Learners can classify human error types in failure cases (intentional/unintentional, cognitive/execution) and propose improvement measures.
Learners can develop a step-by-step approach strategy to solve ill-defined social problems.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
